title: Direct calculation of steady-state hydrodynamic solar wind solutions with newtonian viscosity
summary: Steady-state solutions to the Navier-Stokes equations are known to admit solutions that are singular at the sonic point. Consequently, inviscid solar wind models require special treatment of the solution near the sonic points, and this has proven to be a significant impediment to efficient modeling of the solar wind.
